title: I hear Riot is nerfing Swain's skill-shot based root to address potential damage issues.
body:
http://i.imgur.com/7UlKux7.jpg)

There's this skill called "Nevermove" (aka always move) which cost's on average about 100 mana per cast and has a base cooldown of 18 seconds caps at (10 at **rank 5** (you mainly need the utility in lane at early levels to win lane and not be useless). 

This skillshot takes almost a full second to activate. Let's nerf it to address potential damage problems that he may have. A high pick-rate champion such as Swain has far too much access to high mobility, low cooldowns, and low mana costs. His current state of balance is completely unacceptable. So fuck you Swain.

I don't even play this champion. It just bothers me when I see Riot nerf an under the radar champion in the wrong way and for all the wrong reasons (if any).

{{champion:9}}{{item:3031}}  How's it going?

What about Vladimir? I've never played Swain, Anivia, or Fiddle, so yeah.

Transfusion and Tides of Blood make up for his lack of auto attack speed considering it's on a **4.5** second cooldown and isn't gated my Mana (it does have a health cost, but it also increases regen and healing so... {{item:2003}} covers 4-5 casts) Nevermove is **18** seconds and costs about 1/5th of your entire mana pool at level 2, for a paltry 80 damage (+70% AP of which you have maybe... 40 of? 7 damage)

Ah, good point. Except don't forget that the cost goes up with stacks. I was simply wondering about autoattacks and stuff, not the abilities. Like, are their aa animations and speed/damage and stuff better or worse?

Vladimir, Anivia, Fiddlesticks, and Swain are the worst champions currently for Last Hitting (as far as I remember) However, what people **aren't** discussing is how Vladimir has Tides of Blood to help him clear/push heavily, Anivia's Flash Frost is an AoE with a 1.0 AP ratio (.5 when moving past something and .5 when detonating) and Fiddlesticks' Crowstorm, _while not the best clearing spell,_ still has less of a cooldown and is guaranteed to hit 5 targets.

Waveclear and Last Hitting isn't just _'Oh, their autos are terrible!'_ but you also need to look at if they have a spell that makes up for that. I saw some idiot claiming {{champion:30}} was terrible at CSing... **KARTHUS!**
Oh most definitely. Vladimir has it easier than those few, and once he has WotA and AP, he has one of the best waveclears in the entire game.

Waveclear is looking at a champion and asking 'Can I kill minions effectively with auto attacks?' if the answer to that is no, then ask 'Can I kill them quickly with spells?'

Unfortunately people think the answer to both of those on Swain are either Yes to both (usually the people calling for nerfs and have never played him) or Yes to one and No to the other (to the people who just read his stats and have never played him)

Those of us who have actually played him more than once (and realize he has Counterplay) realize the answer to Both is **No.**

The main difference is that Anivia at level 6 no longer has to use her AA to farm as long as she has sufficient mana pool and regen available to her. Swain never really scales to have good waveclear (especially from a safe distance) whereas Anivia can easily clear a wave without putting herself in any danger whatsoever.
